result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Defrancisco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony J Defrancisco is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony J Defrancisco was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $1,000.00 plus al lmandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 03-23-16 or serve 25 consecutive days in HOC.

09-28-15/ John Siefert
It is the order of the Court allowing that the defendant's Huber privileges be transferred to Waukesha providing both Milwaukee and Waukesha County jails can logistically accommodate such transfer.
Court objects to Electronic Surveillance.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court STAYED the commencement until 09-30-15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J Defrancisco

defendant.name: Defrancisco, Anthony J
defendant.address: S99 W21239 Parker Drive, Muskego, WI 53150

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-28-15 Court order allowing transfer of Huber to Waukesha County and continued objection to ES

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of defense, Court allows transfer to Waukesha County for sentence, but still continues objection to ES.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND AS TO COUNT ONE: THE  PENALTY ENHANCER  IS DISMISSED. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for ZERO days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 9-30-15. 

 Fine of $1000.00 PLUS ALL MANDATORY  COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES  to be paid by 3-23-16 or serve 25 CONSECUTIVE days in the House of Correction.

  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial.  Negotiations are still ongoing, but Court ordered that the case be left on for jury trial on 09/23/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 47.  The State will keep the offer open until one day prior to the jury trial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 47.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for continued  final pre-trial conference in Branch 47. lr  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 47. lr  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 09-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-04-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (4-9-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rosalyning P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/8/15 @ 1:30pm

Defendant Anthony J Defrancisco not in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, state's motion to cancel arrest warrant granted by court.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
